content: I am trying to figure out the font used in the Lean-LOGO and was wondering if anyone could point me to the right font.
I think it is very close to this https://www.myfonts.com/products/pro-light-avenir-next-pro-367746 but must also be a custom variation of the above.
Would it be possible to add it to simple icons?
Utensil Song has marked this topic as resolved.
Utensil Song has marked this topic as unresolved.
Tobias Grosser has marked this topic as resolved.
Tobias Grosser has marked this topic as unresolved.

Thank you @CK. This is helpful. Yet, before buying a font for more than 100$ , I would like to understand if someone knows the actual origin. @Sebastian Ullrich, maybe you have a idea about the origin of the lean font, used both in the LEAN logo as well as in the "THEOREM PROVER" text.
Actually that's before my time, @Soonho Kong might know better
There's been talk of a new Lean logo, I think (sorry, I don't have details!!), so maybe be cautious assuming the current logo is forever!

@Tobias Grosser I think I found the exact font, Code Pro Light.

However, the ∀ in "LEAN" looks like it's custom. It's not just an upside-down A either, since A in that font has a flat top, but it's pointy in the Lean logotype.
Hi, I created the logo in 2013 but I don’t remember which font that I used :-(
Tobias Grosser has marked this topic as resolved.
